"Congress as a whole is less popular than it’s been since polling was
   invented," Cooper wrote in The Hill, a newspaper that closely chronicles
   what’s happening in Congress.

Since Cooper argued that Congress is the most unpopular it has been since
   polling was invented, a bit of history is in order.

The previous
   all-time low was recorded in December 2011, when just 11 percent of
   Americans approved of the way Congress was handling its job.
